result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Matter here for a status conference.  Defense counsel informs the court that he believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Court CONVERTED the $10,000.00 cash bail to a $10,000.00 signature bond with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision. State does not wish to motion the Court for a body attachment at this time.
State requests an adjournment of the trial.
Defense objects and moves for dismissal.
Arguments heard.
Court GRANTS State's request for adjournment of the trial "FOR THE FINAL TIME".

Court addressed bail:  Based upon the speedy trial demand cannot be accommodated due to a second adjournment of the trial, Court CONVERTED the $10,000.00 cash bail to a $10,000.00 signature bond with TURNOVER TO:  Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Conditions of release:  (1) All previously ordered no contact orders remain in effect.  (2) Maintain absolute sobriety.  (3) Submit to random urine screens.  (4) No contact with the victims.
